function.name: and
function.description: Check that both a and b have a value

function.name: or
function.description: Check that at least a or b have a value

function.name: where
function.description: Filter a based on b. Both a and b should be lists.

function.name: where
function.description: Filter a based on b. Both a and b should be lists.

function.name: where
function.description: Filter a based on b. Both a and b should be lists.

function.name: average
function.description: Calculate the average of all numbers in the list.

function.name: sum
function.description: Sum all numbers in the list.

function.name: min
function.description: Calculate the minimum of all numbers in the list.

argument.name: list
argument.description: The numbers you are trying to find the min of.

function.name: count
function.description: Count how many items in a list actually have a value. Ignores 0, false, "", empty.

argument.name: list
argument.description: The list of values to count.

function.name: first
function.description: Get the first item(s) in a list of values.

argument.name: n
argument.description: How many items to return? Defaults to 1.

argument.name: list
argument.description: The list to return items from.

function.returnDescription: If n is not provided or is 1, the first item. Otherwise, a list of the first n items.

function.name: last
function.description: Get the last item(s) in a list of values.

argument.name: n
argument.description: How many items to return? Defaults to 1.

argument.name: list
argument.description: The list to return items from.

function.returnDescription: If n is not provided or is 1, the last item. Otherwise, a list of the first n items.

function.name: $now
function.description: Current date and time as number of milliseconds since January 1st, 1970\. Mostly useful with [date and time functions](?category=datetime) or the `mod` operator.
